tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

node.description:
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/hirano--aya/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hysteric_barbie) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_ya.hirano/) | [Website](http://ayahirano.jp/)

Aya Hirano is a Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Beginning in the entertainment industry as a child actor performing in television commercials, she played her first voice acting role in 2001 in the anime television series [Angel Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/682/). She released her first single "Breakthrough" in 2006, and her first album Riot Girl in 2008. She was formerly contracted to Space Craft Produce, a branch of the Space Craft Group, before moving to the talent agency Grick in August 2011. Her label was Lantis until 2011, when she moved to Universal Sigma. On September 1st, 2022, she announced that she was becoming a freelancer. 

Hirano is widely known for her roles as [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/character/251/) in the [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/) franchise, [Konata Izumi](https://anilist.co/character/2169/) in [Lucky Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1887/), [Misa Amane](https://anilist.co/character/835/) in [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/) and [Lucy Heartfilia](https://anilist.co/character/5186/) in [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/6702/).

In 2011, she temporarily ceased accepting new roles to recover from a pituitary gland tumor that had been affecting her health. She resumed voice acting activities later that year. In 2016, after appearing at a stage play in Tokyo, she went to New York to study abroad for four months.

__Awards:__
- Best Voice Actor at the Tokyo Anime Awards in 2007 for her role as Haruhi Suzumiya.
- Best Rookie Actress at the 1st Seiyuu Awards in 2007 for her role as Haruhi Suzumiya.
- Best Lead Actress at the 2nd Seiyuu Awards in 2008 for her roles as Konata Izumi, Misa Amane and [Layla Serizawa](https://anilist.co/character/2089/)

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/maho_tomita6261) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/maho_tomita6261/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/maho-time/) | [Agency Profile](http://mahoch.fun/profile.html)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. She has appeared in many musicals, TV dramas, movies, and stage plays.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).
**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namimi_sanjyo)**

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Aichi Institute of Technology

**[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/masatomo-ota/)** | **[Artist Profile (First Call Music)](https://firstcallmusic.net/artist/%e5%a4%aa%e7%94%b0%e9%9b%85%e5%8f%8b/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatomoota)**

**Masatomo Oota** is a Japanese guitarist and musician, who does composition and arrangement for anime. He is a part of the two-piece music unit [SCREEN mode](https://anilist.co/staff/119992/SCREEN-mode), and has been since 2013.

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rx6w9YmxY0zly5A)

Originally an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rx6w9YmxY0zly5A)

Originally an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rx6w9YmxY0zly5A)

Originally an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rx6w9YmxY0zly5A)

Originally an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akekodao) | [Agency Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/AkesakaSatomi.html) | [Blog](http://blog.animate.tv/akesaka/)

Satomi got her start in show business in 2001 when she won the "Idol Grand Prix", an idol contest sponsored by the manga magazine Nakayoshi. She became an event character for the anime "Tokyo Mew Mew" by joining the group Mew Five. She made her debut as a voice actress in 2004 in with role of Anzai Futaba from Koi Kaze, and as a stage actress a year later. She released her first single "Akeban!" in 2011. As a part of the BanG Dream! project, she also played the keyboard for the band [Roselia](https://anilist.co/staff/153170/Roselia) as the character Rinko Shirokane up until September 2018, when she was forced to quit after suffering sudden deafness twice. Before Roselia, she had been playing the piano since a young age, and previously played classical music.

Satomi's hobbies include using computers, drawing, reading, gaming and sleeping. Her favorite food is umeboshi, and she loves animals, especially cats.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wiki, edited)
